title: Digital Onboarding & Account Management

sections.title: Modern Account Types & Onboarding
sections.content:
Today, opening an account is often done via a mobile app. This is called **Digital Onboarding**.

- **Neobank**: A digital-only bank without physical branches.
- **Mobile-first**: Designed primarily for mobile apps.
- **Digital ID verification**: Using your camera to scan documents.
- **Selfie verification**: Taking a photo of yourself for security.
- **E-statement**: An electronic version of your bank statement.
- **Push notification**: An alert sent to your phone for transactions.
- **Minimum balance**: The lowest amount of money required to avoid fees.

sections.title: Digital Onboarding Process
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Download App] --> B[Verify Email/Phone]
    B --> C[Scan ID Document]
    C --> D[Take Video/Selfie]
    D --> E[Wait for Approval]
    E --> F[Digital Card Issued]
    F --> G[Initial Deposit]
```

sections.title: Past Simple: Recording Recent Actions
sections.content:
We use the **Past Simple** to talk about completed actions in the past. For regular verbs, we add **-ed**.

**Common Digital Banking Verbs:**
- **Scan** -> Scanned: *I scanned my ID yesterday.*
- **Download** -> Downloaded: *She downloaded the app last night.*
- **Log in** -> Logged in: *He logged in to check his balance.*
- **Transfer** -> Transferred: *They transferred the funds this morning.*
- **Approve** -> Approved: *The bank approved my account in 5 minutes.*
